intro: Guatteria elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are often glossy and dark green in color. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a fragrant aroma that attracts pollinators. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
